channel.title: math.AT updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.AT updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Torsion models for tensor-triangulated categories
item.description: arXiv:2501.05180v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Given a rigidly-compactly generated tensor-triangulated category whose Balmer spectrum is finite dimensional and Noetherian, we construct a torsion model for it, which is equivalent to the original tensor-triangulated category. The torsion model is determined in an adelic fashion by objects with singleton supports. This categorifies the Cousin complex from algebra, and the process of reconstructing a spectrum from its monochromatic layers in chromatic stable homotopy theory. This model is inspired by work of the second author in rational equivariant stable homotopy theory, and extends previous work of the authors from the one-dimensional setting.
item.dc:creator: Scott Balchin, J. P. C. Greenlees, Luca Pol, Jordan Williamson

item.title: A straightening-unstraightening equivalence for $\infty$-operads
item.description: arXiv:2501.05263v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We provide a straightening-unstraightening adjunction for $\infty$-operads in Lurie's formalism, and show it establishes an equivalence between the $\infty$-category of operadic left fibrations over an $\infty$-operad $\mathcal{O}^\otimes$ and the $\infty$-category of $\mathcal{O}^\otimes$-algebras in spaces. In order to do so, we prove that the Hinich-Moerdijk comparison functors induce an equivalence between the $\infty$-categories of operadic left fibrations and dendroidal left fibrations over an $\infty$-operad, and we characterize, for any symmetric monoidal $\infty$-category $\mathcal{C}^\otimes$, the essential image of the monoidal unstraightening functor restricted to strong monoidal functors $\mathcal{C}^\otimes\to \mathcal{S}^\times$
item.dc:creator: Francesca Pratali

item.title: On the cohomology of varieties of chord diagrams
item.description: arXiv:2412.18508v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We study the space of codimension two subalgebras in $C^\infty(S^1, {\mathbb R})$ defined by pairs of conditions $f(\varphi)=f(\psi)$, $\varphi \neq \psi \in S^1$, or by their limits. We compute the mod 2 cohomology ring of this space, and also the Stiefel--Whitney classes of the tautological vector bundle on it.
item.dc:creator: V. A. Vassiliev

item.title: Dirichlet-Voronoi domain and injectivity radius of flag manifolds -- equivariant cell structure on $O(3)/O(1)^3$
item.description: arXiv:2011.06338v3 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: In the first part of this work, we study Dirichlet-Voronoi domains for discrete isometry groups of Riemannian manifolds, in view of constructing cell structures on homogeneous (complete, real) flag manifolds, equivariant with respect to the action of the Weyl group. We give general results, allowing to build such a structure from an admissible one on the domain. In particular, the injectivity radius plays a key role in the method. The second part starts with the computation of the injectivity radius of (real and complex) flag manifolds; a first step towards the application of the method developed in the first part. Then, with the help of the quaternion algebra, we investigate the particular case of the flag manifold $O(3)/O(1)^3$ of $SL_3(\mathbb{R})$: we prove that the results of the first part apply and derive a new $\mathfrak{S}_3$-equivariant cell structure on it, whose cellular complex of $\mathbb{Z}[\mathfrak{S}_3]$-modules is determined.
item.dc:creator: Arthur Garnier

item.title: Partial groups as symmetric simplicial sets
item.description: arXiv:2310.01513v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We give a new characterization of partial groups as a subcategory of symmetric (simplicial) sets. This subcategory has an explicit reflection, which permits one to compute colimits in the category of partial groups. We also introduce the notion of a partial groupoid, which encompasses both groupoids and partial groups.
item.dc:creator: Philip Hackney, Justin Lynd

item.title: Chow ring of the stack of plane nodal curves
item.description: arXiv:2405.11943v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We compute the rational Chow ring of the moduli stack of planar nodal curves of fixed degree and express it in terms of tautological classes. Along the way, we extend Vial's results on Chow groups of Brauer-Severi varieties to $G$-equivariant settings.
item.dc:creator: Alessio Cela, Ajith Urundolil Kumaran, Xiaohan Yan
